qas.question: What kind of transmitter did Bell put in his telephone?
How did Bell refer to his partner in his well known line?
What did the vibrations cause to change?

context: On March 10, 1876, three days after his patent was issued, Bell succeeded in getting his telephone to work, using a <a0_0>liquid<a0_0/> transmitter similar to Gray's design. Vibration of the diaphragm caused a needle to vibrate in the water, varying the <a2_0>electrical resistance<a2_0/> in the circuit. When Bell spoke the famous sentence "<a1_0>Mr. Watson<a1_0/>—Come here—I want to see you" into the liquid transmitter, Watson, listening at the receiving end in an adjoining room, heard the words clearly.
